title: Front entrance of the Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building
description: Front entrance of Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building. Undated photo.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court
source: Connecticut State Library, State Archives, PG 220, Connecticut State Library Collection, Box 12 oversized

title: Connecticut State Library in the State Capitol after 1902
description: Undated photo ca. 1902-1909 of the Connecticut State Library when it was located in the State Capitol. View is facing west.
subject: Connecticut State Library
source: Connecticut State Library, State Archives, PG 200, Connecticut State Government, Institution and Parks Collection, Box 3 of 3, Captiol Building-Interior Views-State Library

title: George Seymour Godard, State Librarian, 1900-1936
description: George Godard served as State Librarian from 1900 until his death in 1936.
subject: Godard, George S. (George Seymour), 1865-1936
source: Connecticut State Library, detail from portrait.

title: New York Sunday Herald article
description: Newspaper clipping from State Librarian Godard's scrapbook of a New York Sunday Herald article dated August 5, 1906, describing the decision to construct a new building to serve both the State Library and Supreme Court.
source: RG 012, Connecticut State Library, Box 70a, George Godard's scrapbook, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Architectural drawing of the front of the Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building
description: Architectural drawing of the front of the Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction

title: Architectural drawing of the Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building
description: Architecural drawing of the front of the Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building by Donn Barber and Edward Hapgood.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: Connecticut State Library, Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building Plans and Elevations, v. 2, call no. Probate Vault 727.8 C716d

title: Property map of building site
description: Property map of land purchased for new building indicates adjoining private property. A white, T-shaped outline indicates the placement for the new building. The front stairs will be where the word "of" appears in "State of Conn" in the foreground.
source: Connecticut State Library, Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building Plans and Elevations, v. 2, call no. Probate Vault 727.8 C716d

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction viewed from State Capitol, 1909-01-07
description: View of construction looking south from the State Capitol. Architects for the project were Donn Barber of New York and E.T. Hapgood of Hartford. The builder and general contractor for the project was Marc Eidlitz & Son of New York. Construction began on October 23, 1908 and according to terms of the contact, the building was to be completed by October 23, 1910. The front entrance of the building will be near where the largest tree stands in the middle foreground. The grid of planks outlines the excavation area for the Supreme Court side of the building. Washington Street is on the far left (east), Lafayette St. on the near left (east) and Oak St. (partially obscured) on the right (west). Photo taken January 7, 1909.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction, ca.1908
description: On site view of construction. View is looking southeast, toward Lafayette St. and shows the excavation of the Memorial Hall section of the building. Men using shovels and pickaxes are excavating the area and loading up horse-drawn wagons.The foundation for the central portion of the building extends down to bedrock. Undated photo ca. Fall 1908.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction, 1908-12-09, details
description: Detail of workmen loading horse drawn wagons with rock and debris. Photo dated December 9, 1908.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction, 1908-12-05
description: On-site view of construction, looking east. Horse drawn wagons are lined up to deliver supplies and remove debris. The line of planks the man is standing on in the middle foreground outline the front (north) wall of the Court side. Photo dated December 5, 1908.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction viewed from State Capitol, 1909-01-22
description: View of construction looking south from the State Capitol. Derricks are in place and foundation footings are visible on the Library side (to the left). In the foreground on Capitol Avenue, horse drawn wagons are carting away debris while an automobile travels down the street. Photo dated December 5, 1908.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction, 1909-01-22
description: On-site view of construction, looking south, down into the construction pit. Men are laying bricks on a day when the high temperature is only 27 degrees F. Bricks were manufactured by the Tuttle Brick Co. of Middletown, Connecticut.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction, 1909-02-05
description: On site view of construction, looking south into the basements below Memorial Hall. The Library is on the left, the Court on the right. All footings for the building are of stone concrete, and the foundation walls, up to the finished grade, are of brick laid in Portland cement mortar. Photo dated February 5, 1909.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.

title: Connecticut State Library and Supreme Court Building construction viewed from State Capitol, 1909-02-23
description: View of construction looking south from the State Capitol. Foundation walls for the Supreme Court side are visible (right) and progress continues on the granite exterior wall of the Library side (left). The granite is from the Bethel Quarry in Bethel, Vermont. Photo dated February 23, 1909.
subject: Connecticut State Library;Connecticut. Supreme Court;Library buildings--Design and Construction
source: RG 060, The Commission to Make Repairs on the Capitol and to Procure a Site for a New Building for State Officials, Box 1, State Archives, Connecticut State Library.
